newsitem.title: USA: Ford to name Nasser as operations head - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Ford to name Nasser as operations head - WSJ.

text.p: Ford Motor Co's board of directors is expected to announce on Thursday that it will appoint Jacques Nasser to president of the company's automotive operations, the Wall Street Journal reported.
The newspaper said in its Thursday edition that Nasser would replace Edward Hagenlocker, whom the board would name chairman.
The promotions would come into effect immediately, it added.
Nasser has been group vice president in charge of product development since May 1994, while Hagenlocker has been in charge of operations since May 1994, as well, the newspaper said.
The vice chairman post has remained vacant, it said.
